dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 281 RH: Grizzly Bear State Management Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman (for herself, Mr. Zinke, Mr. Fulcher, Mr. Stauber, and Mr. Downing) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on January 9, 2025

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to reissue a final rule relating to removing the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem population of grizzly bears from the Federal list of endangered and threatened wildlife, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Grizzly Bear State Management Act.

section.header: Reissuance of final rule relating to Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem population of grizzly bears

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Interior shall reissue the final rule entitled Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Removing the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem Population of Grizzly Bears From the Federal List of Endangered and Threatened Wildlife (82 Fed. Reg. 30502 (June 30, 2017)) without regard to any other provision of law that applies to the issuance of that final rule.
The reissuance of the final rule described in subsection (a) (including this section) shall not be subject to judicial review.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
